def: Species are any group of molecules/entities that exist within structures (either membranes or compartments) and can be acted upon by reactions or fluxes. Species are unique to a particular structural class (e.g. cytosol, nuclear membrane) for all instances of a given class. Older version of VCell append species context to the given name (e..g a species called "Calcium" within "Cytosol" was given the name Calcium_cytoplasm
Pathway Commons mirrors the content of ten major pathway databases, providing 3,436 pathways including 565,977 interactions and 116,073 physical entities from 1,295 organisms.
